title: (x) Lapin Kulta logo - custom designed {Mark S}
content: It looks like a custom lettering job to me. Notice the differences between the A's and L's.
author: Mark Simonson

comments.content: LetterHead's [Hensler](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142741/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/magnumopusone/hensler.shtml) is a close one too.
[American Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142741/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/american-gothic/urw-t-bold/testdrive.html?s=LAPIN%2BKULTA&p=48) with some squeezing could be close.

[Newtext Demi](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142741/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-newtext-2/newtext-demi/testdrive.html?s=LAPIN%2BKULTA&p=48) is even closer, but also would need some squeezing. The T is better for one thing.
Jim Parkinson's [Modesto](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142741/http:/www.typedesign.com/fonts/modcond.html) is in the ballpark.
